00081 template<class T>
00082 static bool
00083 compare(T elem, relop op, double value)
00084 {
00085     switch (op) {
00086       case dods_greater_op:
00087     return elem > value;
00088       case dods_greater_equal_op:
00089     return elem >= value;
00090       case dods_less_op:
00091     return elem < value;
00092       case dods_less_equal_op:
00093     return elem <= value;
00094       case dods_equal_op:
00095     return elem == value;
00096       case dods_not_equal_op:
00097     return elem != value;
00098       case dods_nop_op:
00099     throw Error(malformed_expr, "Attempt to use NOP in Grid selection.");
00100       default:
00101     throw Error(malformed_expr, "Unknown relational operator in Grid selection.");
00102     }
00103 }
00104

00106 #ifndef WIN32
00107 template<class T>
00108 void
00109 GSEClause::set_map_min_max_value(T min, T max)
00110 {
00111     DBG(cerr << "Inside set map min max value " << min << ", " << max << endl);
00112     std::ostringstream oss1;
00113     oss1 << min;
00114     d_map_min_value = oss1.str();
00115 
00116     std::ostringstream oss2;
00117     oss2 << max;
00118     d_map_max_value = oss2.str();
00119 }
00120 
00121 #endif
00122 
00123 #ifndef WIN32
00124 template<class T>
00125 void
00126 GSEClause::set_start_stop()
00127 {
00128     // Read the byte array, scan, set start and stop.
00129     T *vals = 0;
00130     d_map->buf2val((void **)&vals);
00131 
00132     // Set the map's max and min values for use in error messages (it's a lot
00133     // easier to do here, now, than later... 9/20/2001 jhrg)
00134     set_map_min_max_value<T>(vals[d_start], vals[d_stop]);
00135 
00136     int i = d_start;
00137     int end = d_stop;
00138     while(i <= end && !compare<T>(vals[i], d_op1, d_value1))
00139     i++;
00140 
00141     d_start = i;
00142 
00143     i = end;
00144     while(i >= 0 && !compare<T>(vals[i], d_op1, d_value1))
00145     i--;
00146     d_stop = i;
00147 
00148     // Every clause must have one operator but the second is optional since
00149     // the more complex for of a clause is optional.
00150     if (d_op2 != dods_nop_op) {
00151     int i = d_start;
00152     int end = d_stop;
00153     while(i <= end && !compare<T>(vals[i], d_op2, d_value2))
00154         i++;
00155 
00156     d_start = i;
00157 
00158     i = end;
00159     while(i >= 0 && !compare<T>(vals[i], d_op2, d_value2))
00160         i--;
00161 
00162     d_stop = i;
00163     }
00164 }
00165 #endif
00166 
00167 void
00168 GSEClause::compute_indices()
00169 {
00170 #ifdef WIN32
00171     //  Allows us to get around short-comming with MS Visual C++ 6.0
00172     //  templates
00173     char dummy;
00174 
00175     switch (d_map->var()->type()) {
00176       case dods_byte_c:
00177     set_start_stop((char *)(&dummy));
00178     break;
00179       case dods_int16_c:
00180     set_start_stop((char *)(&dummy));
00181     break;
00182       case dods_uint16_c:
00183     set_start_stop((char *)(&dummy));
00184     break;
00185       case dods_int32_c:
00186     set_start_stop((char *)(&dummy));
00187     break;
00188       case dods_uint32_c:
00189     set_start_stop((char *)(&dummy));
00190     break;
00191       case dods_float32_c:
00192     set_start_stop((char *)(&dummy));
00193     break;
00194       case dods_float64_c:
00195     set_start_stop((char *)(&dummy));
00196     break;
00197     default:
00198     throw Error(malformed_expr, 
00199              "Grid selection using non-numeric map vectors is not supported");
00200     }
00201 #else
00202     switch (d_map->var()->type()) {
00203       case dods_byte_c:
00204     set_start_stop<dods_byte>();
00205     break;
00206       case dods_int16_c:
00207     set_start_stop<dods_int16>();
00208     break;
00209       case dods_uint16_c:
00210     set_start_stop<dods_uint16>();
00211     break;
00212       case dods_int32_c:
00213     set_start_stop<dods_int32>();
00214     break;
00215       case dods_uint32_c:
00216     set_start_stop<dods_uint32>();
00217     break;
00218       case dods_float32_c:
00219     set_start_stop<dods_float32>();
00220     break;
00221       case dods_float64_c:
00222     set_start_stop<dods_float64>();
00223     break;
00224     default:
00225     throw Error(malformed_expr, 
00226              "Grid selection using non-numeric map vectors is not supported");
00227     }
00228 #endif // WIN32
00229 
00230 }

00232 // Public methods
00233 
00235 GSEClause::GSEClause(Grid *grid, const string &map, const double value,
00236              const relop op) 
00237     : d_map(0),
00238       d_value1(value), d_value2(0), d_op1(op), d_op2(dods_nop_op),
00239       d_map_min_value(""), d_map_max_value("")
00240 {
00241     d_map = dynamic_cast<Array *>(grid->var(map));
00242     if (!d_map)
00243     throw Error(string("The variable '") + map 
00244             + string("' does not exist in the grid '")
00245             + grid->name() + string("'."));
00246 
00247     DBG(cerr << d_map->toString());
00248 
00249     // Initialize the start and stop indices.
00250     Array::Dim_iter iter = d_map->dim_begin();
00251     d_start = d_map->dimension_start(iter);
00252     d_stop = d_map->dimension_stop(iter);
00253 
00254     compute_indices();
00255 }
00256 
00258 GSEClause::GSEClause(Grid *grid, const string &map, const double value1,
00259              const relop op1, const double value2, const relop op2) 
00260     : d_map(0),
00261       d_value1(value1), d_value2(value2), d_op1(op1), d_op2(op2),
00262       d_map_min_value(""), d_map_max_value("")
00263 {
00264     d_map = dynamic_cast<Array *>(grid->var(map));
00265     if (!d_map)
00266     throw Error(string("The variable '") + map 
00267             + string("' does not exist in the grid '")
00268             + grid->name() + string("'."));
00269 
00270     DBG(cerr << d_map->toString());
00271 
00272     // Initialize the start and stop indices.
00273     Array::Dim_iter iter = d_map->dim_begin();
00274     d_start = d_map->dimension_start(iter);
00275     d_stop = d_map->dimension_stop(iter);
00276 
00277     compute_indices();
00278 }

00292 bool
00293 GSEClause::OK() const
00294 {
00295     if (!d_map)
00296     return false;
00297     
00298     // More ...
00299 
00300     return true;
00301 }
